Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: jerky \jerk"y\, n. [Corrupted from Peruv. charqui dried beef.] Meat, especially beef, that has been cut in strips and dried; meat that has been jerked; see first {jerk}, v.; as, beef jerky [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
jerky \jerk"y\, a. 1. Moving by jerks and starts; characterized by abrupt transitions; as, a jerky vehicle; a jerky style. [1913 Webster]
2. Foolish; ridiculous; stupid. [slang] [PJC]

jerky adj : not having a steady rhythm; "an arrhythmic heartbeat" [syn: {arrhythmic}, {jerking}, {unsteady}] n : meat cut in strips and dried in the sun [syn: {jerked meat}] [also: {jerkiest}, {jerkier}]
